result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather M. Beahm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Heather M. Beahm is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Heather M. Beahm was found guilty of Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Heather M. Beahm was found guilty of Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Heather M. Beahm was found guilty of Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Heather M. Beahm was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Heather M. Beahm in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF90 & 15CM72:
Atty Hendee moves to amend Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF90 to Misd. Theft 943.20(1)(d)(3a).  
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5 in 14CF90 and Count 1 in 15CM72.  Count 1 in 14CF90 to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Klopp agrees with the two charges being amended and agrees to the agreement.  Atty Klopp states that the defendant has already completed an assessment. Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea to both cases.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 (amended, 3 (amended), 4 & 5 in 14CF90 and Count 1 in 15CM72.  Count 1 in 14CF90 to be dismissed and read-in.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements.  Atty Hendee gives the court victim impact statements to review.
Jennifer Beahm makes a statement to the court.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Klopp makes sentencing arguments.  
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 2 (amended), 3 (amended), 4 & 5  in 14CF90 and Ct. 1 in 15CM72:  Withhold Sentence, 3 years Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00 on each of the five counts
Restitution = $2,318.90 + 10% surcharge = $2,550.79 (7 victims as per the restitution supplement)
AODA and any follow-up treatment (assessment has already been completed)
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Ct. 2 in 14CF90:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; stayed for 1 year with conditions:  If Restitution and Surcharge are paid in full within that 1 year, the defendant will not have to serve the 90 day jail sentence.  If it is not paid within that 1 year, the stay would be lifted and the defendant would be taken into custody to serve that 90 day sentence.
DNA Sample & Surcharge is not ordered.

Ct. 1 in 14CF90 to be dismissed and read-in

Final pre-trial at 01-08-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 02-11-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Heather M. Beahm in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that new criminal cases will be filed against the defendant; the matter is not resolved and requests a trial date.
Atty Gumz agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Set trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Heather M. Beahm in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will possibly be participating in treatment court.  The defendant has met with the Coordinator today and asks for a reset to give him time to speak with Ms. Runge.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Heather M. Beahm in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.   Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Prior: 259 E. Montello Street; #1, Montello, WI 53949
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Appear for booking today
No possession of any controlled substance without a valid perscription

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:

No possession of any controlled substance without a valid perscription

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.
Set for Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
